comments.raw_text:
We should link to MDN docs for any highlighted items in the view source window. The linking can be a context menu or hotkey activated. A list of items upcoming.

This will make it very easy for people to learn more about the web and increase the value of the MDN docs as Web wide resources.
comments.author: asa@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Specifically when you view source, there is *tons* of code highlighting, and thus it already knows and can distinguish the following items, which we can directly algorithmically link to MDN pages:

* light blue DOCTYPE - https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Mozilla%27s_DOCTYPE_sniffing
* purple HTML elements, e.g. head:
  - https://developer.mozilla.org/en/HTML/Element/head

The following are nice-to-haves which would require additional expansion of MDN to support the target URLs:
* black HTML attributes, e.g. rel:
  - https://developer.mozilla.org/en/HTML/Attribute/rel
* red named character entities, e.g.: –
  - https://developer.mozilla.org/en/HTML/Entity/ndash

The following are nice-to-haves which would require additional syntax highlighting/parsing support in View Source:
* rel values - space separated values, e.g. rel="me"
  - https://developer.mozilla.org/en/HTML/Attribute/rel/me
* javascript - language structures, DOM objects properties methods.
* stylesheets - CSS selectors, at-rules, properties, values
* meta names
* microformats class names, including microformats-2 syntax
